citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Pyrantel that has been used this spring per the licensee had an expiration date of 12/7/2022. The use of expired
medications might not treat/prevent the condition since the product might not be as effective once expired. Ensure to
properly discard the expired dewormer and only use medications that aren't expired.
***Correct by 5/22/2023.

Per records, a 52-day old male shi-poo puppy DOB 11/16/2022 was sold with a group of puppies that the buyer picked up
on 1/7/2023. Puppies leaving before 8 weeks of age can cause them additional stress and increase risk of health
problems. Ensure puppies sold for transport in commerce are at least 8 weeks of age (56 days) and have been weaned.
***Maintain correct by 5/22/2023.

Two maltipoo puppies (DOB 4-18) were seen walking off of their solid floor mat to the suspended floor area where their
feet were going through the openings. To prevent injury, floors of mesh or slatted construction cannot allow dogs' feet to
pass through. Ensure that enclosures are maintained so that dogs' feet cannot go between/through openings in the floor.
***Facility corrected prior to exit interview.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The indoor areas of enclosures were clean, however five of the outdoor suspended runs on the East side of the building
have waste on the floor that dogs can contact that has been there longer than a day. Also on the same side there was
excessive soiled material on the ground underneath runs that had moderate odors. Daily spot cleaning of all surfaces
dogs can contact is required and helps reduce odors and disease risk. More frequent cleaning underneath the runs is
important to reduce diseases hazards, odors, and areas for pests (flies) to nest in.
Ensure that a routine of daily spot cleaning outdoor runs is made and maintain the areas under outdoor runs free from
excessive soiled material.
***Correct by 5/23/23.

Twenty-three dogs are overdue for their 2023 physical exam that must be done within 12 months of the previous physical
exam. A complete head to tail physical exam of each dog is required at least once yearly and helps ensure each dog is
healthy. Ensure that each dog that is overdue on its physical exam gets one by the attending veterinarian and then
ensure the schedule of physical exams is kept so that each dog gets a physical exam every year (not more than 12
months since the previous exam).
***Correct by Aug 1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Pyrantel that has been used this spring per the licensee had an expiration date of 12/7/2022.  The use of expired 
medications might not treat/prevent the condition since the product might not be as effective once expired.   Ensure to 
properly discard the expired dewormer and only use medications that aren't expired. 
***Correct by 5/22/2023. 
2.130 
   
Minimum age requirements. 
Per records, a 52-day old male shi-poo puppy DOB 11/16/2022 was sold with a group of puppies that the buyer picked up 
on 1/7/2023.   Puppies leaving before 8 weeks of age can cause them additional stress and increase risk of health 
problems.  Ensure puppies sold for transport in commerce are at least 8 weeks of age (56 days) and have been weaned. 
***Maintain correct by 5/22/2023. 
3.6(a)(2)(x) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two maltipoo puppies (DOB 4-18) were seen walking off of their solid floor mat to the suspended floor area where their 
feet were going through the openings.  To prevent injury, floors of mesh or slatted construction cannot allow dogs' feet to

pass through.  Ensure that enclosures are maintained so that dogs' feet cannot go between/through openings in the floor.  
***Facility corrected prior to exit interview. 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The indoor areas of enclosures were clean, however five of the outdoor suspended runs on the East side of the building 
have waste on the floor that dogs can contact that has been there longer than a day.  Also on the same side there was 
excessive soiled material on the ground underneath runs that had moderate odors.  Daily spot cleaning of all surfaces 
dogs can contact is required and helps reduce odors and disease risk.  More frequent cleaning underneath the runs is 
important to reduce diseases hazards, odors, and areas for pests (flies) to nest in.  
Ensure that a routine of daily spot cleaning outdoor runs is made and maintain the areas under outdoor runs free from 
excessive soiled material.  
***Correct by 5/23/23. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Twenty-three dogs are overdue for their 2023 physical exam that must be done within 12 months of the previous physical 
exam.   A complete head to tail physical exam of each dog is required at least once yearly and helps ensure each dog is 
healthy.  Ensure that each dog that is overdue on its physical exam gets one by the attending veterinarian and then 
ensure the schedule of physical exams is kept so that each dog gets a physical exam every year (not more than 12 
months since the previous exam). 
***Correct by Aug 1, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
